name: lcmaps-plugins.lcmaps-plugins
description: It provides the functionality for making authorization decisions based on the combination of (type of) CA and VO. This is needed for supporting the IGTF IOTA profile of CAs: due to the lower Level-of-Assurance (LoA), those CAs are only allowed in combination with higher LoA VOs. We are also busy with creating a plugin (a PIP) for the Argus framework for providing the same functionality there, but that is not ready yet.
releaseNotes:
lcmaps-plugins-basic 1.6.2-1.7.1  
- Move to new lcmaps-gridmapfile and lcmaps-gridmapdir functions,
syncing code with the lcmaps-plugins-robot code-base. These new
functions are a major rework of the original ancient and buggy
lcmaps-gridlist codebase. Among other things it fixes a number of
grid-mapfile parsing problems and problems when using a default
grid-mapfile.
- Extensive cleanup and synchronization of different banning and mapping
plugins ban_dn, localaccount and poolaccount.

lcmaps-plugins-robot 0.0.1-0.0.5 - new component needed *only* for infrastructure supporting the LToS.
See http://wiki.nikhef.nl/grid/Lcmaps-plugins-robot

lcmaps-plugins-verify-proxy 1.5.7-1.5.9
- add commandline tool verify-proxy-tool.
- add some logging and warnings on key-length and signing algorithm problems.
- numerous small improvements and bugfixes.

lcmaps-plugins-vo-ca-ap 0.0.2 
- install default vo-ca-ap-file

lcmaps-plugins-voms 1.7.0-1.7.1 (see also lcmaps-plugins-basic)
- Move to new lcmaps-gridmapfile and lcmaps-gridmapdir functions,
syncing code with the lcmaps-plugins-robot and lcmaps-plugins-basic
code-base. These new functions are a extensive rework of the original
ancient and buggy lcmaps-gridlist codebase. Among other things it
fixes a number of grid-mapfile parsing problems and problems when
using a default grid-mapfile.
- Extensive cleanup and synchronization of different banning and mapping
plugins ban_fqan, voms_localaccount and voms_poolaccount.
- Synchronize and improve GID mapping options between voms_localaccount
and voms_poolaccount plugins. Several of these flags were either
inconsistent or missing.
